title: Blackened Chicken Penne
directions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Core, deseed, and dice poblano into 1/2 inch pieces. Trim and thinly slice scallion, separating whites from greens. Thinly slice garlic. Finely chop tomato.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels. Toss in a large bowl with a large drizzle of olive oil, blackening spice, and a few big pinches of salt.
Once water is boiling, add penne to pot. Cook until al dente, 9 - 11 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water.
Meanwhile, heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add poblano and a pinch of salt. Cook, without stiring, until poblano is lightly charred, 3 - 4 minutes.
Add chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, 4 - 6 minutes.
Stir in scallion whites and garlic. Cook until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
Stir in half the tomato and a pinch of salt. Reduce heat under pan to medium low.

Stir cream cheese and 1/3 cup reserved pasta cooking water into pan with chicken mixture. Add penne and cook, stirring, until thoroughly combined, 1 - 2  minutes. Turn off heat. Stir in Monterey Jack, stock concentrate, 2 tbsp buttter, and as much hot sauce as you like. Stir until butter is melted. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide penne between bowls or plates. Garnish with scallion greens and remaining tomato. Drizzle with any remaining hot sauce if desired.
